meanings.definition: relating to or occurring in a tube
meanings.sent1: The tubal container kept the pencils organized.
meanings.sent2: The tubal design of the straw made it easy to drink from.
meanings.sent3: The tubal shape of the tunnel made it perfect for the toy cars to race through.
meanings.sent4: The tubal structure of the beehive fascinated the young biologist.
meanings.sent5: The tubal nature of the pipe allowed water to flow smoothly.

meanings.definition: of or relating to the fallopian tubes
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the tubal surgery to the patient.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sharp pain in her tubal region.
meanings.sent3: The tubal examination was uncomfortable but necessary.
meanings.sent4: The tubal blockage was causing fertility issues.
meanings.sent5: The tubal procedure helped improve her reproductive health.

meanings.sent1: The plumber fixed the leak in the tubal under the sink.
meanings.sent2: She placed the flowers in the tubal to keep them fresh.
meanings.sent3: The tubal carried water from the roof to the garden.
meanings.sent4: The tubal of the telescope allowed for clear stargazing.
meanings.sent5: The tubal of the vacuum cleaner got clogged with debris.
